name: df-sseq
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(csseq, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, cun(cv(s0), ccom(clsw, cseq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), cmpo(s2, s3, universe, universe, co(cv(s2), cconcat, cs1(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))))), cxp(cn0, csn(co(cv(s0), cconcat, cs1(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))))))))
bodyPretty: âŠ¢ seqstr =(s0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, s1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ â†¦(s0 â‹ƒ(lastS âˆ˜ seq((# ` s0)((s2 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, s3 âˆˆ ğ•Œ â†¦(s2[++]<"(s1 ` s2)">)),(â„•0 Ã— {(s0[++]<"(s1 ` s0)">)}))))))
comment: Define a builder for sequences by strong recursion, i.e. by computing the value of the n-th element of the sequence from all preceding elements and not just the previous one. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 21-Apr-2019.)
